antiquities Zahi Hawass said that during the revolt several major artefacts had been stolen from the Egyptian museum, including a statue of Tutankhamun, better known as King Tut. The objects missing from the famed museum include a gilded wood statue of the 18th Dynasty king Tutankhamun being carried by a goddess and parts of another statue showing him harpooning, he said. Looters had broken into the museum off Cairo's Tahrir Square on January 28, during clashes between protesters and riot police. Meanwhile
